page.title: 06 A Sixth-Former's View
page.content: I am studying 'A' level History, English and Economics hoping to gain the necessary qualifications to enter further education or a career. The work at 'A' level is much harder than at 'O' level and the methods of teaching are more relaxed and informal. Pupils are required to work on their own which demands more self-discipline. The classes are smaller but we are expected to be more mature and responsible. The sixth former is expected to set an example to the rest of the school and I have to carry out numerous prefect duties. As well as academic studies I take part in a community programme at an old people's home which is a most rewarding experience. The sixth former has an important role in maintaining the high reputation of our school.
